instructions: On your Android phone or tablet, open the Google app . At the bottom right, tap More and then Settings and then Voice . Under "Hey Google," tap Voice Match . Turn on Hey Google .
On your Android phone or tablet, open the Google app . Say "Hey Google" or tap the Microphone .

On your Android phone or tablet, go to myactivity.google.com. On the left, click Other Google activity and then Voice match enrollment and then View data . At the top right, click More and then Delete all .

From the home screen, tap Hangouts. Select desired message thread. Touch and hold the picture or video. Tap desired image or video. Tap Settings on the top right. From the drop-down, tap Delete . Tap OK .
From the home screen, tap Hangouts. Select desired message thread. Touch and hold the picture. Tap Save attachment . Select the location to save to. Tap OK .

On your computer, open the webpage http://samsung.com/kies. Click Download for Windows . Click DOWNLOAD KIES 3 . Follow the prompts to download and install the drivers. When prompted, connect your phone to your computer using the USB cable. For best results, use the charging cable that comes with the device. Follow any additional prompts to launch the KIES application. Once launched, the KIES dashboard displays three tabs: Basic information Sync Backup/Restore

From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Under 'Connections', scroll to and tap Tethering and Mobile HotSpot . Connect your phone to your computer via USB cable. For best results, use the cable that came with the phone. To share your connection, select the USB tethering check box. Tap OK if you would like to learn more about tethering. Once connected, Tethered appears under 'USB tethering' and the check box is selected.
